GameData:
-
-
Hell -
Hell -
Hell -
We greet you, mighty Hecatia Lapislazuli, governer of three Hells. Yours are the realms of the guilty, the wicked, and the impure, whose karma condemns them to suffering before they might be allowed to live again. In spite of infrastructural troubles, you were responsible for the near-defeat of the Lunarians, whom none could challenge before, and the corruption of the Moon with the essence of life. With powerful allies and subordinates under your command, including the kishin chiefs and the Yama, and three bodies with which to rule your domains, there is no world beyond your reach.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Oh Hecatia, the Hells are now in dire need. Lacking finances, manpower, and space, they are now but a shadow of their former terrible glory. The time has come to ressurect them and strike fear and respect into the worlds once more. Will you take responsibility? Will you connect the worlds under your influence? Can you forge in hellfire three civilizations that will stand the test of time?
-
Hell -
When the Yama judge a soul to be blackened with sin, it is taken out of the cycle of reincarnation and imprisoned in Hell until such time as its karma has run its course. There are many Hells for many karmic purposes, although they collectively are referred to as a singular Hell. In addition to the Hell of the Earth, there are the Hells of the Moon and the Otherworlds, which includes smaller worlds such as the Dream World and Gensokyo. Each Hell is separately administrated by the Yama and the oni, while Hecatia Lapislazuli governs all three together with her three bodies.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Hell of the Otherworlds used to be located beneath Gensokyo, but due to overcrowding, it was moved to a larger location. Without the finances to run the old location in addition to the new one, it was handed over to Satori Komeiji in the Palace of the Earth Spirits, and is now known as Former Hell.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Economic troubles have plagued Hell's administration for many years, and despite efforts such as creating income with condemned labour and stalls along the Road of Liminality, Hell's upkeep has only become more expensive as more souls flow through.
-
Hecatia Lapislazuli feminine
-
Hecatia Lapislazuli -
Goddess of Hell -
Goddess of Crossroads -
???-Present -
About -
Hecatia Lapislazuli is a goddess who presides over the Hells of Earth, the Moon, and the Otherworlds using her three bodies. She is a mysterious and capricious figure who tends to stay out of the spotlight, letting the Yama be the face of Hell.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The only other thing known about her is her grudge against Chang'e, a prisoner in the Lunar Capital. Long ago, Chang'e's husband Houyi shot down the Suns, weaking Hell's power in the process. To get at her, and as a favour to her friend Junko whose grudge was even greater, she forced the Lunarians to flee the Moon by sending her subordinate, a Hell fairy named Clownpiece, to taint the pure surface of the Moon with the power of life. When the Lunarians escaped into the Dream World, Hecatia was waiting for them, and she laid siege to them with Junko until she was defeated by a plan laid by Eirin Yagokoro of Eientei. Since then, Hecatia has resolved to meet more interesting people in Gensokyo.
-
2 additional Settlers after building the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. Cannot build Settlers. [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from number of Cities reduced by two thirds. Each original City allows airlifting and grants one delegate to whomever controls it. -
Trinitarian
-
Ministry of Right and Wrong -
Replaces the Courthouse. Removes extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied Cities and is granted for free in your first three settled Cities. Every three Ministries provide +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and [ICON_PEACE] Faith. -
The Ministry of Right and Wrong is the administrative body of Hell and also governs the cycle of reincarnation. It is the seat of power of the Yama, from which they judge the dead and guide them along their appropriate paths. Because it is essential to keeping Hell's affairs running smoothly, its presence can be felt anywhere that Hell has influence. -
The Ministry of Right and Wrong's presence in [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied Cities will inspire [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and [ICON_PEACE] Faith, further incentivizing aggressive expansion. By conquering a lot of land early, Hell can get a helpful boost to [ICON_PEACE] Faith production.
-
Yama -
Replaces the Swordsman. 100% [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength bonus against Cities. Cities with a Yama garrisoned in them cannot have other Religions spread to them. (The religious protection is lost on upgrade.) -
The Yama are the administrative class of Hell, empowered to judge the dead and decide their fate. Although there used to be few of them, the growing number of human souls necessitated an increase in Yama to match, most of which are statues of Jizo who wished to serve as Yama in order to protect people from being sent to Hell. The majority of Yama are more concerned with management than fighting, but all can serve as able warriors should the need arise. -
The Yama's power to take Cities is useful on offence, and its religious protection on defence. Simply having one stationed in each of your Cities will keep them safe as you spread your own from three separate corners of the map.
-

Yeah.
Of course, right?
I mean, duh.
Yeah, sure.
Totally.
For sure.
Uh-huh.
Wow, really? You're gonna regret that.
Wow, that's totally rude, you know.
Huh. You've got a lot of guts, you know that?
Hey, like, I'm declaring war on you. Just so you know.
That's totally it! I'm declaring war now!
War time! Put up a fight, 'kay?
Aw, shucks. Who would've thought you could beat all three of me?
Wow, you're amazing. I'm gonna bow out now, 'kay? Good luck out there!
Aw, I totally lost. You're too good at this.
I think you're gonna want to give me this.
This is super rude of me, but like, can I have this stuff? I really need it right now.
Hey, Hell's not doing so hot right now. Shoot me a pick-me-up?
Hell no.
Uh, no?
Not.
No way.
Nah.
Mmm... Sorry, no.
No dice.
Woah, hey there! Nice to meet you! Welcome to Hell!
Hey, nice t'meetcha. You like my place? I've got two more just like it.
Name's Hecatia. What's up? You in the ruling business, too?
Bye!
Laters!
See ya!
Catch you later!
Drop in whenever, yeah?
'Kay, see ya.
Uh-huh.
Hey, what's up?
What can I do for ya?
Hey, don't mind the other mes. I'm a little short of hands right now.
Heya. What do you need?
What's up? You need something?
Yeah?
Oh, it's you.
Shoot.
I'm all ears.
What? You want to talk to a dead spirit or something? I can arrange that.
Yeah? Hang on, talk to this body. This one needs to do something.
Sure, go ahead.
You wanna talk? What about?
If it's about Clownpiece, take a number.
Aw, man. You're too good!
Uh, no. Little more, please.
Jack it up a bit first.
Uh, no? I'm not trading with you unless you make it sweet.
Ooh, tempting. How about a little more for me?
I don't know, I could use a bit more.
You can give me more than that, can'tcha?
I need like, just a little bit more.
Can you make a little more attractive?
I totally need more for that.
That's gotta be like, the third worst offer I've heard.
Sorry, can't do that.
Seriously?
Whatever, I guess.
Super! Thanks for trading!
Yeah, that's cool.
Can we just do this trade? No drama.
Hey, wanna trade?
You want this stuff? 'Cause I want that stuff.
Seriously?
Sorry, pal. Can't help ya right now.
I can't just like, give stuff away. You know how much it takes to keep three Hells running?
Shucks. Well, you win. Here's the stuff you wanted.
I totally have you covered.
Heck, why not? Don't say I never did anything for ya.
Man, all right.
Aw, fine.
Heh, I tried.
Ah, well.
Don't feel bad or nothing. Hell's kinda famous for this, you know?

Totally tuning you out. -
No, seriously. -
I told you, can't do that. -
Huh? You forget something? -
Yeah? You need something else? -
Ugh, I thought you were gone. -
Why'd you come back? We had a good thing going, with you leaving and all.
-
Hi, there. -
You want a drink or something? -
How's it going? -
Yo. -
Hey, what's up? -
Oh, hey. You want something? -
Uh, hey. -
What? -
Oh, it's you. I'm kinda busy, what do you want? -
Man, this totally isn't going how I planned. -
Ah ha ha, this is looking super bad for me, isn't it? -
So, wanna make peace? -
I'm ready to call it quits. How about you? -
I'm so over this war. Can we make peace now? -
If you've come to beg for your life, I'll listen. I won't agree to anything, but I'll listen. -
I'm not done with you. -
You can't fight Hell. Give up now, 'kay? -
Hey, what's up? Don't worry about that Research Agreement - I've got my three best people on it. -
Don't think I'm over you breaking your promise. -
Hey there, comrade! -
So, what do you want to do about {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}? -
We'll crush {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} from four sides. Count on it! -
I almost feel sorry for {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}, you know? -
Huh? Aren't you, like, fighting someone else right now? -
Yo. How goes the war? -
You trying to say something with all those troops, maybe? -
That's a lot of troops, man. You're making me nervous, or whatever. -
You're taking a lot of land around here. Not a good idea, y'know? -
Gee, you're like, on fire with your expansion right now. -
Are you, like, trying to cramp me or something? -
I had my eye on that land you bought up, y'know. -
Your military is amazing, you know that? No one's gonna mess with you. -
Hey, you've got a really super economy. Can I get some pointers? -
Oh, hey. Are you having expansion problems, too? -
Maybe it's just me, but isn't your army, like, super tiny? -
So, what's it gonna be? Military threats? Gonna shake a big stick at me? -
Just so you know, my denouncement counts as three. -
I'm not gonna take my denouncement back or anything, if that's what you're here for. -
You're gonna have to denounce me two more times, pal. -
Oh, so you're friends with {1_PlayerName} now. I don't want to judge, but bad company. -
You made friends with {1_PlayerName}? Nice. Good choice. -
You really shouldn't have denounced {1_PlayerName}. -
Seems we have an enemy in common. That's cool. -
Woah, there. Coming on a little strong right now. -
Um, maybe later. -
{1_CivName} is going way, waaaay too far. Let's denounce them together. -
I want to teach {1_CivName} a lesson. You want in? -
Not cool.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
You did so not just do that.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
I didn't want to do this, but this is where we're at.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR]) -
Not a good idea there, friend. -
Wow. That's super rude of you. -
I see you made friends with {1_CivName}. Nice move. -
Seriously? {1_CivName}? -
{1_PlayerName} is a friend of Hell itself. You want to go down that road? -
Nice one denouncing {1_CivName}. Someone's gotta teach 'em a lesson. -
You made friends with {1_CivName}, right? I'll do that, too. -
Totally with you on {1_CivName}. Tooootally. -
Teaming up with {1_CivName}, huh? I got it, I got it. You'll regret it eventually. -
I saw you make friends with {1_CivName}, so I thought, "They must be good people after all!" Thanks for showing me the way.

Oh, geez. You totally broke your promise and settled near us. Bad move. -
No, really. Stop buying all the land. -
Hey, could you maybe stop buying up all the land near me? Thanks. -

Sorry for attacking that City-state, but I'm not sorry. -
Oh, we attacked that City-state you were protecting. No big, right? -

Would it be crazy if I said you should declare your friendship with Hell? -
I think we're pretty well friends now. Want to make it official? -

All right, time's up. Let's do this. -
Y'know, it was fun at first, but now I've got a big old grudge with your name on it. No forgiveness! -
Well, I guess that makes us enemies. -
You're really good at this whole leadership thing, huh? -
You're super, you know that? I've never met anyone as interesting as you. -

You're a bloodthirsty little oni, aren't you? -

I'm just itching to use this nuke. You want to give me a reason? -
You're kind of a bully, you know that? You'll go to Hell for sure. -
Just look at how you treat your people. You know you'll go to Hell if you don't make them happy, right? -
Geez, you're super behind right now. Do you still only have that many cities? -
Are you sure your cities are really cities? They look kind of empty. -
I think the reason your civilization is such a failure is because it has, like, basically no cultural identity.

{2_MajorCivName:textkey} has taken back its guarantee of protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.

I'm gonna pass on that. -

You're totally giving me no choice... Well, here you go. -

And I'd do that like, why? -

Ha ha, what? No way. -

I'm basically screwed if I give you that much, so no. -
Again? The answer's still no. -

I've got better things to do than fight you. Can we end it? -
Here's my price for leaving you alone. Trust me, you'd better take it. -

I got you something. You like? -

I can't keep doing that deal the way it is. Context changes, right?

I definitely can't say no to that. -

Sounds good to me. -
That's cool, I guess. -
Fine with me. -
You're smart. I like that. -
Sweet. Thanks for the loot! -
All right, all right. I forgive you. -
I can't do that. -
That's totally not fair. -
Can't do that, sorry. -
Seriously? -
Like I'd take that. -
Looks totally okay to me. -
I don't see a problem with it. -
How's this? -
Does this work for you? -
I can't make a deal for that. -
That's way too unfair for any deal you could make.

You're trying to attack me? You've got guts. -
Not even going to warn me, huh? -
Taking advantage of my weakness? I don't blame you, but I'm still going to hate you for it. -
I guess it was inevitable you'd do something like this, huh? -
You're seriously attacking me with that army? This should be interesting. -
You think that was a good idea? -
You totally just made the worst decision of your life. -
You want to die that badly? I'll make sure you end up in Hell! -
I've been waiting for you to do that! -
Interesting. Let's see where this goes! -
Sounds like it's war time. This'll be fun! -
Even if you kill one of me, I won't die. Show me everything you've got! -
You actually did it! I totally didn't think you'd be dumb enough to attack me right now! -
Aw, come on. -
Really? Did you have to do that? -
We had a good thing going! I'll make sure you regret this.

The Earth, the Moon, or the Otherworlds? Pick which body you want to be killed by! -
Sorry, but this is gonna be three-on-one. -
All right, the gloves are off. I'm itching to fight! -
People who deceive will fall into Hell. -
Hell needs more land. I think I'll take yours! -
"You have land that I want." For that reason alone, I'll drop you into Hell! -
"You're in the way of my victory." For that reason alone, I'll drop you into Hell! -
"Your land is poorly defended." For that reason alone, I'll drop you into Hell! -
Hey, where's your army? This is gonna be too easy. -
Welp, I'm out of options. Time for a last-ditch effort! -
So it's come to this. C'mon, put 'em up! -
Thanks for being my friend, but I'm totally going to kill you now. -
Guess what? I'm going to kill you! -
Thanks for being my shield. Now I can strike you where you're weakest! -
Aw, geez. I wish it didn't come to this. -
Sorry, but I gotta do this. -
"You didn't give me what I want." For that reason alone, I'll drop you into Hell!

What're your terms? -
All right, make an offer. -
Go ahead. -
Sweet. Thanks! -
Nice. Thanks for playing! -
Uh, nnno. -
Sorry. My grudge is too big for that right now. -
Seriously? We're just warming up.
-
Sweet. -
Cool. -
Nice. -
Thanks. -
Hey, thanks. -
Thanks a lot. -
Aw, geez. -
Really? Aw. -
Aw. -
Whatever, I guess. -
That's the way the cookie crumbles, right? -
Well, so be it. -
Thanks for returning that worker I lost. You're a sweetie, y'know that? -
You take my land, you best be prepared for the consequences. -
Yeah, I figured as much. -
You say that, but we both know what you're about to do. -
That's a real shame. -
Keep 'em moving, then. -
Deal with it. -
Wow, nice loyalty. -
Well, I can't blame ya. -
Saw that coming. -
You and me? We're not friends. -
We're cool, then? Cool. -
We're cool, then? Cool. -
We're cool, then? Cool. -
We're cool, then? Cool. -
We're cool, then? Cool. -
Just so you know, Hell has nukes. I mean my Hell, not the old one.
-
You're following Freedom, too? Sweet. Everyone makes their own destiny, right? -
Cool to see you've put some Order into your civilization. Share the labour, right? -
Looks like you've become an Autocracy. It's a pretty good system, am I right? -
Hey, get your stupid spies out of Hell before they stay here permanently. -
C'mon, don't be spying on me. Do it to someone else! -
All right, cool. -
This is gonna give you bad karma, you know. -
Aw, fine. I'll send my spies somewhere else. -
Who's gonna stop me? Not you, that's who. -
Thanks for the warning about {@1_CivAdjective}. I knew they were up to something sneaky. -
Just so you know, {1_PlayerName} is totally plotting against you. Tell me if you hear anything about me, 'kay? -
Just so you know, {1_PlayerName} is totally planning to attack {2_CityName}. Tell me if you hear anything about me, 'kay? -
Just so you know, {1_PlayerName} is totally planning to attack you. Tell me if you hear anything about me, 'kay? -
Just so you know, {1_PlayerName} is totally planning to attack {2_CityName} with a bunch of ships. Tell me if you hear anything about me, 'kay? -
Just so you know, {1_PlayerName} is totally planning to attack you with a bunch of ships. Tell me if you hear anything about me, 'kay? -
So, we killed a spy, and turns out he was yours. You got anything to say about that? -
Hey, no biggie on the spying thing, right? I mean, the spy's dead now. -
Ah ha ha, busted. -
I know you're spying on me. Not cool. -
Hey, stop spreading your dumb religion around here. No one's gonna follow you over a real goddess! -
Nuts. Well, I get it. -
Cool, thanks. -
Thanks so much. -
You're gonna regret that. -
I mean, I'm an actual goddess, but whatever. I'll stop telling people about it. -
You realize I'm a goddess, right? Faith is like, my thing. -
Ready to give up? -
I might agree to spare you if you make it worth it for me.
-
Why don't you do something about it? -
Good answer. -
Whatever. I'm not stopping. -
Thanks for understanding. I gotta do what I gotta do. -
I totally can't match that. -
Woah, that's too much value. I can't make a fair deal for that.
Nice proposal. You can bet I'll be supporting you at the {1_LeagueName}.
Just so you know? I think your proposal to the {1_LeagueName} sucks.
Hey, thanks for supporting me at the {1_LeagueName}. It means a lot, really!
Aw, you supported our proposal to the {1_LeagueName}. Thanks!
You got in the way of my proposal to {1_LeagueName}. I'm, like, super not happy with that.
You're seriously going to fight me at the {1_LeagueName}? I hope you know what you're getting into.
Gee, thanks for supporting us as host of the next World Congress. We're gonna be unstoppable!
'Scuse me, but that's Hell you're digging up. There's a lot down there you don't want to see.
I'm not going to stop. Why would I do that?
Fine, fine. I'll stop digging up your land.
You really want to disagree over this?
Thanks. I really appreciate it.
Hell's inmates want Freedom, and it's all your fault. Do you know what a disaster it would be if I gave them rights?
The oni are all over me right now about adopting Order. What's productive about socializing Hell?
The Yama are calling for an Autocracy because of you. I'm waaay too overworked for that!
Isn't it sad that Hell has more Freedom than your civilization? It's like, why even keep trying?
You should just give in and adopt Order already. Just look at how great Hell is doing with its own inmates running it!
Your people are calling for Autocracy 'cause it works. I should know; I've got three of 'em!
Hey, you freed your people from oppression. Good on you for caring.
Hey, you stopped the exploitation of your people. Good on you for giving them rights and stuff.
Hey, you decided to actually be a leader. Good on you for taking responsibility.
Man, now Hell's full of your pop music and blue jeans. Where did we go so wrong?
Nice to see your people fear Hell like they should. Better keep it that way, right?
- -
